articles.author: Tareq Sikder
articles.description:
BitGo,  
a U.S.-regulated cryptocurrency custody firm, obtained a cryptocurrency custody  
license from the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BaFin). This  
development secures BitGo's presence in the European market.
From New York Trust Charter to  
BaFin License
Germany  
has been active in Europe regarding the regulation and oversight of  
cryptocurrency and digital asset custody. The country has implemented laws and  
regulations that encourage both banks and specialized custody providers to  
engage in handling of digital assets while offering associated services.
“BaFin  
is recognized as one of the world's key trendsetters in crypto regulation. It enables  
the progress that digital currencies entail while creating a secure regulatory  
framework,” said Dejan Maljevic,…
articles.title: BitGo Secures German Crypto Custody License from BaFin

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
The trial of the former CEO of the defunct crypto exchange FTX, Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), continued on October 31, with the prosecution cross-examining the defendant. Despite the line of questioning from the prosecutor, SBF managed to spin his narrative on what went on at the crypto exchange. However, it remains to be seen if this will be enough to sway the jury. 
 
Sam Bankman-Fried Says He Didn’t Know Much About The Bug 
 
So far, the prosecution had been able to establish that Sam Bankman-Fried was in the know of everything that went on at the defunct crypto exchange and trading firm Alameda Research and, in fact, was the mastermind of all the illicit activities that went on there.
 
 
With this in mind, the defendant was hell-bent on creating doubts in the minds of the jury members. Whi…
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Defense Breaks Down: Testifies To Issues Within FTX

articles.author: Lubomir Tassev
articles.description:
Social media company X is now worth less than half of what Elon Musk paid for Twitter, according to internal documents quoted by the press. The billionaire investor purchased the platform, Twitter at the time of acquisition, for $44 billion last October. He has previously admitted to overpaying for it. 
 
Social Media Giant X Worth Less Than Half of the Price Elon Musk Paid for Twitter
 
Elon Musk’s social media platform X, formerly Twitter, has valued itself at $19 billion, a number of media outlets revealed at the start of the week. That’s around 55% less than what the tech entrepreneur paid for the company in October 2022.
 
The figure is based on equity in the company offered to employees in the form of restricted stock units at $45 a share, the New York Times and Fortune Magazine repo…
articles.title: X Valued at $19 Billion a Year After Musk Bought Twitter for $44 Billion, Reports

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Dogecoin (DOGE) enthusiasts may need to temper their optimism, as a prominent cryptocurrency analyst warns of a looming deep pullback. The meme coin’s recent struggle to breach a critical resistance level has raised concerns about its short-term prospects.
 
In the world of cryptocurrency trading, resistance levels play a crucial role. These levels represent price points where an asset has historically struggled to move past. Resistance levels are significant because they reflect the collective sentiment of traders and investors. When an asset encounters resistance and fails to break through, it often signifies a lack of buying pressure and can lead to a reversal in price.
 
At the time of writing, Dogecoin is trading at approximately $0.067399 via CoinGecko, experiencing a 2.6% dip in the…
articles.title: Dogecoin Bulls On Hold: Analyst Cautions Vs. Premature DOGE Expectations

articles.author: Sergio Goschenko
articles.description:
The Brazilian Tax Authority (RBF) recently published an article acknowledging the growth in stablecoin trading in the country, which has taken the Brazilian cryptocurrency market by storm. The most transacted stablecoin is Tether’s USDT, which has moved more than 271 billion reals (close to $54 billion) since the organization started registering these purchases in 2019.
Brazilian Tax Authority Reports Stablecoin Trading Growth
The Brazilian tax authority (RBF) has recently reported “vertiginous growth” in the trading of stablecoins, tokens tied to the value of other currencies, in the country, surpassing the volumes of cryptocurrencies like BTC. The organization states that their characteristics make them “more stable in value,” expanding the possibility of using them as a means of payment…
articles.title: Brazilian Tax Authority Acknowledges ‘Vertiginous Growth’ of Stablecoin Trading

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
In a major announcement yesterday, Shytoshi Kusama, the lead developer of the Shiba Inu project, unveiled the ambitious “Shib Name Service” (SNS) on the Shibarium platform. The announcement was made through a blog post shared via X (formerly known as Twitter), with Kusama teasing, “No tricks here, only the first of many treats.”
 
Shiba Inu’s Name Service Goes Live
 
The Shib Name Service (SNS) stands at the heart of this announcement which was teased with a countdown. Beyond just being a new feature, SNS represents “a new era on Shibarium” and an innovative approach to how users interact with addresses.
 
Traditional blockchain addresses, characterized by their complex strings of letters and numbers, have been a deterrent for many users. But as Kusama explained, with SNS, “No longer will …
articles.title: Shiba Inu Lead Dev Heralds New Era For Shibarium

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Fifteen years ago, an unidentified individual known as Satoshi Nakamoto introduced the groundbreaking white paper Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System, redefining how value is transferred in the digital realm.
 
This concise nine-page document outlined revolutionary concepts, such as cryptographic hashing, block architecture, and timing mechanisms, fundamentally altering societal perspectives on money and initiating a global movement toward decentralized currencies.
 
Nakamoto’s vision not only transformed the technological landscape but also sparked a reevaluation of traditional financial systems, reshaping discussions on monetary value and control.
 
 

 
 
Bitcoin’s 15-Year Journey: A Phenomenal Evolution
 
Celebrating its 15th birthday today, Bitcoin’s remarkable journey has …
articles.title: Bitcoin Celebrates 15 Years: Forecasting The Boundless Growth Ahead

articles.author: Sam Reynolds
articles.description: Frax founder Sam Kazemian says his team has been "left in the dark" by the domain registrar as to what happened.
articles.title: Frax Finance Says its Domain Name Has Been Hijacked

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
Over seven years ago, on April 30, 2016, the first decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) emerged, marking a significant shift in the digital world. However, just three months later, a cyberattack brought it down, leading to its unfortunate collapse. Today, the landscape has transformed dramatically, with numerous DAOs thriving, and 179 treasuries surpassing $1 million. In total, these organizations hold $18 billion in assets, both liquid and vested. As of 2023, the top five DAO treasuries alone hold $11 billion, spread across various token assets.
 
2023’s Leading DAOs
 

 
Various sectors in the world of digital assets have been hit by the crypto winter but decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) have seen growth. In essence, a DAO stands as a digital governance model, orchest…
articles.title: Blockchain Governance — A Look at the Top 5 DAO Treasuries in 2023

articles.author: Lubomir Tassev
articles.description:
America’s securities regulator has been urged to decide if it will approve a plan to transform Celsius Network into a bitcoin mining firm. The proposal seeks to repay customers of the bankrupt cryptocurrency lender with both crypto assets and stock in a new publicly traded mining entity.
 
New York Judge Hopes for Expedited SEC Decision on Celsius’ Repayment Proposal
 
Judge Martin Glenn, who oversees the bankruptcy of Celsius, has called on the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to quickly decide whether it will authorize the company to transform itself into a crypto mining firm, Bloomberg reported.
 
During a court hearing on Monday, Glenn told a lawyer representing the regulator that he hopes the SEC will expedite the decision-making process because Celsius and its creditors …
articles.title: Judge Urges for SEC Decision on Planned Celsius Restart as Crypto Miner

articles.author: Dalmas Ngetich
articles.description:
Ethereum venture capitalists (VCs) are “not stupid” and know that investing in the world’s largest smart contract platform won’t result in the “multiples” they desire, according to a crypto user. Going by the handle R89Capital, claims that VCs are now looking at Ethereum layer-2 assets as vehicles to exit the market, dumping “Ponzi tokens.”
 
Ethereum VCs Exiting ETH For “Ponzi” Tokens?
 
The user opines that the primary reason why ETH prices may not surge in multiples like emerging tokens, including meme coins like PEPE, for instance, is because of the relatively large market cap. 
 
According to trackers on October 31, ETH has a market cap of over $215.8 billion and is the second largest after Bitcoin (BTC). Typically, coins with higher market caps are harder to manipulate and usually ha…
articles.title: Are Ethereum Venture Capitalists Losing Hope In ETH?

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler has wished Bitcoin’s white paper a happy anniversary. In addition to his playful remark about Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto dressing up in a Halloween costume, Gensler issued a stern warning to crypto firms, emphasizing the importance of complying with securities laws.
 
SEC Chair Gary Gensler’s Message on the Bitcoin White Paper’s 15th Anniversary
 
The chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Gary Gensler, has wished Bitcoin’s white paper a happy anniversary. In a post on social media platform X on Tuesday, the regulator wrote: “Happy 15th anniversary to Satoshi’s famous white paper that started crypto.”
 
He also attempted to make a humorous remark regarding Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto’s Hallo…
articles.title: SEC Chair Gensler Wishes Bitcoin’s White Paper Happy Anniversary With Warning for Crypto Firms

articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
October 31, 2023, marked the 15th anniversary of the release of the Bitcoin whitepaper, a seminal document that laid the foundation for developing the Bitcoin network. 
 
Authored under the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto, the whitepaper outlined a decentralized digital currency’s key concepts and principles, igniting a revolution in finance and technology.
 
As the cryptocurrency community celebrated this significant milestone, Gary Gensler, the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) chair, made an intriguing statement regarding Satoshi Nakamoto’s identity. 
 
Bitcoin Anniversary Surprise
 
In a recent post on X (Formerly Twitter), SEC’s chair Gensler posed a rhetorical question, wondering if Satoshi Nakamoto were to dress up as themselves for Halloween, would anyone be able to…
articles.title: Bitcoin Whitepaper Celebrates 15th Anniversary As SEC Chair Calls For Compliance

articles.author: Jesse Hamilton
articles.description: A Coinbase (COIN) effort to drum up a cross-country swell of amateur crypto advocates – the nonprofit Stand With Crypto – has paid off with a surge of more than 100,000 individuals getting involved in the opening weeks, organizers say.
articles.title: Coinbase-Backed Advocacy Group Enlists Crypto Masses, Raises $2M From 80,000
